page.title: 03DROPMORE SCHOOL
page.content: Dropmore School occupies a building dating back to the 17th century when the Fortesque family owned it.They opened the school for the children of their gardener(he had 13 children).Since then two more buildings have been added one in Victorian times and the other in the early seventies. The school log books go back quite some time.Some of these extracts tell us how many children attended school at various times.For example in 1874 fifty-six children were at school.The school achieved its highest roll during the second world war due mainly to evacuees from London.
